alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 8:33PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Albany and west central Laramie Counties through 915 PM MDT... At 832 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Rock River to 6 miles northwest of Laramie. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Laramie, Rock River, Tie City Campground, North Crow Campground, Bosler, Baldy Peak, University Of Wyoming War Memorial Stadium, Wheatland Reservoir 3 and Yellow Pine Campground. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 295 and 322. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
